description: Schema for all the data Habitat makes available in rendered templates

_88package_identifier.description: A Habitat package identifier, split apart into its constituent components

___name.description: The name of the Habitat package

___origin.description: The origin of the Habitat package

___version.description: The version of the Habitat package

___release.description: The release of the Habitat package

_88svc_member.description: Represents a member of a service group

___persistent.description: A misspelling of `permanent`; indicates whether a member is a permanent peer or not

___leader.description: Whether this member is the leader in the service group (only meaningful in a leader topology)

___update_election_is_running.description: Whether an update leader election is currently running for this service

___cfg.description: The configuration the member is currently exporting. This is constrained by what is defined in `pkg_exports`, where the values are replaced with the current values (e.g., taking into account things like user.toml, gossiped configuration values, etc.)

___update_election_is_finished.description: Whether an update leader election for this service has finished

___org.description: The organization portion of a service group specification. Unused at this time.

___election_is_finished.description: Whether a leader election for this service has finished

___departed.description: Whether this member has been departed from the ring (i.e., permanently gone, never to return).

___election_is_no_quorum.description: Whether there is quorum for a leader election for this service

___update_election_is_no_quorum.description: Whether there is quorum for an update leader election for this service

___suspect.description: Whether this member is considered "suspect", or possibly unreachable, from a network perspective.

___sys.description: An abbreviated version of the top-level {{sys}} object, containing networking information for the member.

___http_gateway_port.description: Listening port for Supervisor's HTTP gateway.

___ip.description: The IP address of the running service.

___gossip_port.description: Listening port for Supervisor's gossip connection.

___gossip_ip.description: Listening address for Supervisor's gossip connection.

___http_gateway_ip.description: Listening address for Supervisor's HTTP gateway.

___ctl_gateway_ip.description: Listening address for Supervisor's Control Gateway.

___hostname.description: The hostname of the running service. Defaults to `localhost`

___ctl_gateway_port.description: Listening port for Supervisor's Control Gateway.

___alive.description: Whether this member is considered alive and connected to the ring, from a network perspective.

___application.description: The application portion of a service group specification. Unused at this time.

___update_follower.description: Whether this member is an update follower in the service group (only meaningful in a leader topology)

$eref.description: A Habitat package identifier, split apart into its constituent components

___name.description: The name of the Habitat package

___origin.description: The origin of the Habitat package

___version.description: The version of the Habitat package

___release.description: The release of the Habitat package

___pkg.description: The identifier of the release the member is running

___environment.description: The environment portion of a service group specification. Unused at this time.

___service.description: The name of the service. If the service is running from the package `core/redis`, the value will be `redis`.

___update_leader.description: Whether this member is the update leader in the service group (only meaningful in a leader topology)

___election_is_running.description: Whether a leader election is currently running for this service

___group.description: The group portion of the service's complete group name. In the group name `redis.default`, the group's value is `default`.

___follower.description: Whether this member is a follower in the service group (only meaningful in a leader topology)

___confirmed.description: Whether this member is confirmed dead / unreachable, from a network perspective.

___svc.description: Information about the current service's service group

___http_gateway_port.description: Listening port for Supervisor's HTTP gateway.

___ip.description: The IP address of the running service.

___version.description: Version of the Habitat Supervisor, e.g., `0.54.0/20180221023448`

___gossip_port.description: Listening port for Supervisor's gossip connection.

___gossip_ip.description: Listening address for Supervisor's gossip connection.

___http_gateway_ip.description: Listening address for Supervisor's HTTP gateway.

___ctl_gateway_ip.description: Listening address for Supervisor's Control Gateway.

___hostname.description: The hostname of the running service. Defaults to `localhost`

___ctl_gateway_port.description: Listening port for Supervisor's Control Gateway.

___permanent.description: Set to true if a Supervisor is being used as a permanent peer, to increase Ring network traffic stability.

___pkg.description: Details about the package currently running the service

___svc_static_path.description: The location of any static content for the Habitat service, e.g., `/hab/svc/redis/static`.

___svc_var_path.description: The location of any variable state data for the Habitat service, e.g., `/hab/svc/redis/var`.

___origin.description: The origin of the Habitat package

___ident.description: The fully-qualified identifier of the running package, e.g., `core/redis/3.2.4/20170514150022`

___svc_user.description: The value of `pkg_svc_user` specified in a plan.

___svc_path.description: The root location of the source files for the Habitat service, e.g., `/hab/svc/redis`.

___env.description: The runtime environment of your package, mirroring the contents of the `RUNTIME_ENVIRONMENT` metadata file. The `PATH` variable is set, containing all dependencies of your package, as well as any other runtime environment variables that have been set by the package. Individual variables can be accessed directly, like `{{pkg.env.PATH}}` (the keys are case sensitive).

___svc_files_path.description: The location of any gossiped configuration files for the Habitat service, e.g., `/hab/svc/redis/files`.

___exports.description: A map of export key to internal configuration value key (i.e., the contents of `pkg_exports` in your plan). The key is what external services consume. The value is a key in your `default.toml` file that corresponds to the data being exported.

___name.description: The name of the Habitat package

___svc_pid_file.description: The location of the Habitat service pid file, e.g., `/hab/svc/redis/PID`.

___svc_run.description: The location of the rendered run hook for the Habitat service, e.g., `/hab/svc/redis/run`.

___version.description: The version of the Habitat package

___deps.description: An array of runtime dependencies for your package based on the `pkg_deps` setting in a plan

$eref.description: A Habitat package identifier, split apart into its constituent components

___name.description: The name of the Habitat package

___origin.description: The origin of the Habitat package

___version.description: The version of the Habitat package

___release.description: The release of the Habitat package

___svc_group.description: The value of `pkg_svc_group` specified in a plan.

___svc_data_path.description: The location of any data files for the Habitat service, e.g., `/hab/svc/redis/data`.

___release.description: The release of the Habitat package

___svc_config_path.description: The location of any templated configuration files for the Habitat service, e.g., `/hab/svc/redis/config`.

___path.description: The location where the package is installed locally, e.g., `/hab/pkgs/core/redis/3.2.4/20170514150022`. Note that this is _not_ a `PATH` environment variable; for that, please see the `env` key above.

___exposes.description: The array of ports to expose for an application or service. This value is pulled from the pkg_exposes setting in a plan.
